content: ghislaine gloves suggested yarn these gloves were designed for a soft yarn in a light fingering or heavy lace weight the sample is shown in knitwitches seriously gorgeous cashmere and silk and i have knitted a similar pair in laceweight cashmere the pattern is very adaptable and could easily be modified to suit a range of yarn weights measurements length 8 circumference 6 7 unstretched both can easily be adjusted yardage 200 yards gauge my gauge was 9 stitches and 12 row to the inch the pattern is written in 2 sizes with a 7 stitch pattern repeat instructions for the larger size are shown in square brackets if like me you are a tight knitter or are aiming for a wider hand the larger size may suit you but otherwise i would suggest the smaller size if neither suits your yarn or gauge you can vary the number of pattern repeats or reduce or increase the width of the stocking stitch bands currently 5 stitches for my first version of these gloves i cast on 48 stitches and used a pattern repeat of 8 stitches needles i used 2 5 mm dpns but i am a very tight knitter and you may wish to try smaller needles lower edge using a provisional cast-on method cast on 48 56 stitches and join to work in the round place a marker to indicate the beginning of the round if you find this helpful knit 5 rounds stocking stitch then 1 round of yo k2 decrease to form the picot edge then a further 5 rounds stocking stitch for the next round gradually undo the provisional cast-on and knit each live stitch together with a cast-on stitch to form the folded hem then knit one further round as follows small size kf&b into first stitch then knit to end of round increase 1 stitch 49 stitches or medium/large size knit one further round of stocking stitch there are many helpful videos on you-tube demonstrating provisional cast-on methods i knitted into the back of a crochet chain if you would prefer not to use a provisional cast-on you could cast-on loosely using a normal method and knit into the cast-on stitches or sew the hem together at the end arm row 1 *yo ssk knit 5* repeat until end of row row 2 *k2tog yo knit 5* repeat until end of row repeat these 2 row until the arm reaches the desired length ending after row 2 i knitted 40 row in all until the arm measured just under 4 including the picot edge 1 thumb gusset the gusset is formed by increasing 1 stitch on either side of the first section of faggoting every 4 row so that the first lace section continues up the side of the thumb as follows 1st increase row 1 m1l yo ssk m1r knit 5 continue in pattern to end of row increase 2 stitches row 2 & 4 k1 k2tog yo k6 continue in pattern
